item.title: Balancing Innovation And Interoperability: Navigating Prebid’s Transaction ID Change
item.description: Prebid’s Transaction ID change sparks debate over publisher innovation vs. open standards, raising questions about transparency and interoperability. Terry Guyton-Bradley, Head of Retail Media at Tata Consultancy Services, shares his insights.

item.title: What Ad Ops Teams Need to Know About Privacy Now
item.description: Privacy Lawyer Jessica Lee answers these questions for publishers: How much liability do publishers carry for downstream vendor behavior? Are probabilistic age estimates enough? What does “strictly necessary” really mean for measurement?

item.title: One Band, One Sound
item.description: When publishers gather to address sales, product, and operations alignment, old frustrations resurface. But, so do new frameworks, candid stories, and solutions worth taking home.

item.title: Singing The AI Scraping Blues At Sell Side Summit Nashville
item.description: The Nashville Sell Side Summit theme “Beyond the Browser,” resonated with publisher concerns around AI-powered, zero-click answer engines and the need to meet audiences outside of their own websites, which are receiving less referral traffic from search and social.

item.title: From Manual Mayhem to Machine Mastery: How Swivel’s AI Agents Are Rewriting the Ad Ops Playbook
item.description: Swivel is putting AI agents to work for publishers, automating the messy middle of ad ops so teams can focus on strategy. From faster troubleshooting to smarter workflows, here’s how they’re reshaping the sell-side playbook.

item.title: How Sell-Side Curation Is Reshaping The Future Of Programmatic
item.description: The rise of sell-side curation is a response to signal loss and a strategic reorientation of the programmatic ecosystem, one that unites data fidelity, cost efficiency and omnichannel scale in one fell swoop.

item.title: What Happens When Publishers Use OpenSincera to Get Access To The Buy Side’s Media Quality Metrics?
item.description: For publishers to understand how the market values their ad supply, they need visibility into metrics that have traditionally been more visible to buyers than to sellers. OpenSincera is a potential solution for that.

item.title: No title
item.description: As privacy constraints and AI-driven search upend the value of traditional signals, publishers are scrambling to keep every impression countable and valuable—especially on browsers like Safari and Firefox. But more than half admit they’re not monetizing that cookieless traffic effectively. That’s a lot of lost revenue. According to new research,…

item.title: Can Your Security Stack See ChatGPT? Why Network Visibility Matters
item.description: Generative AI platforms like ChatGPT, Gemini, Copilot, and Claude are increasingly common in organizations. While these solutions improve efficiency across tasks, they also present new data leak prevention for generative AI challenges. Sensitive information may be shared through chat prompts, files uploaded for AI-driven summarization, or browser plugins that bypass familiar security controls.

item.title: ​​Build a Complete Smart Home Monitoring System
item.description:
Your smart home devices generate vast amounts of scattered data. This tutorial will show you how to centralize this data

item.title: Podcast: The Evolution of Code Review: From Bug-Finding to Team Building
item.description:
In this podcast, Shane Hastie, Lead Editor for Culture & Methods, spoke to Greg Foster about the evolution and purpose of code reviews, building teams with kindness, expertise, and urgency, and how AI tools are changing software development.

By Greg Foster

item.title: Live Sports Wins Direct Deals, But The CTV Scatter Market Is Perfect For Programmatic
item.description:
With the razzle-dazzle portion of the upfronts long over, the ad industry is now learning the impact of those presentations. Early indications forecast softer upfront deals than in years past, but what we’re seeing is more complicated than that. Live sports remains one of the hottest commodities, with NBC boasting its biggest sports upfront ever. […]

The post Live Sports Wins Direct Deals, But The CTV Scatter Market Is Perfect For Programmatic appeared first on AdExchanger.

item.title: Laying the groundwork for smarter, AI-driven marketing
item.description:
Rules-based campaigns limit your agility. AI decisioning reacts in milliseconds for peak relevance. Learn to build the data and governance to unlock it.

The post Laying the groundwork for smarter, AI-driven marketing appeared first on MarTech.

item.title: Signal introduces free and paid backup plans for your chats
item.description: Privacy-focused messaging app Signal announced on Monday that it's introducing a feature that allows users to back up their text conversations for free, along with the last 45 days of media.
